title: Reference pattern matching on tuples behaves unexpectedly
body:
I'm seeing what looks like unsound behavior while using pattern matching on a tuple reference, where the tuple itself contains references - `&(&1, &2)` or `&(&"Hello".to_owned(), &"World".to_owned())`. 

Below is a minimal reproducible example:

```rust
   // (1)
    let items = (&1, &2);
    let (a, b) = &items;

    let (a, b) = &items; // a & b are &i32
    let _: &i32 = a;  // Works
    let _:  i32 = *a; // Errors. expected `i32`, found `&i32` 
    let _:  i32 = **a; // Works. Is this suggesting a is &&i32?
    
    // (2)
    let mut map = HashMap::<String, String>::new();
    map.insert("Hello".to_owned(), "World".to_owned());
    map
        .iter()
        .find(|(k, v)| {
            let _: &String = k; // Works
            // let _: String = k; // Errors. expected `String`, found `&&String`
            let _: String = **k; // Works. Is this suggesting k is &&String?
            true
        })
        .unwrap();
```
I ran into the error while using code like `(2)`, where I was using the `find` method on a map of `<String, String>` while iterating over the map using `iter()`. The iterator's `Item` is `(&String, &String)` and when using it with the find method I was using a pattern as shown above - `|(k, v)|`. I was expecting k and v to be `&&String`, which seems true based on the above example. 

However, when I tried to match using a pattern like `|(&k, &v)|`, I got the below error -

```
error[E0507]: cannot move out of a shared reference
 --> src/main.rs:8:16
  |
8 |         .find(|(&k, &v)| k == "Hello")
  |                ^^-^^^-^
  |                  |   |
  |                  |   ...and here
  |                  data moved here
  |
  = note: move occurs because these variables have types that don't implement the `Copy` trait

```
Given that `k` and `v` are `&&String`, me using the pattern `(&k, &v)` should move a string reference into k and v and not the actual strings themselves. So how am I moving out of a shared reference?
